intro: Stilpnopappus, commonly known as the desert sunflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the sunflower family (Asteraceae). These plants are native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. Stilpnopappus species are characterized by their robust stems, hairy leaves, and showy yellow to orange flowers. They typically grow in sandy or rocky soils and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. The genus includes several species, such as Stilpnopappus arizonicus and Stilpnopappus tenuifolius, which are often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
